block-definition.comment: Sets the global instrument used for playing notes.

inputs.input: PianoPiano Brass={ French Horn Trumpet Tuba } Strings={ Banjo Bass, Acoustic Bass, Electric (Finger) Cello Guitar, Acoustic Guitar, Electric Harp Koto Sitar Violin } Woodwinds={ Bassoon Clarinet Flute Oboe Saxophone Shakuhachi } Drums={ Cabasa Snare Drum Bass Drum Closed Hi-Hat Open Hi-Hat Mid Tom High Tom Crash Cymbal } Other={ Accordion Marimba Organ Vibraphone }

block-definition.comment: Sets the global volume to the selected percentage.
Sets the default volume of the selected instrument to the specified percentage.

block-definition.s: Play Note %'Note' for Duration %'Duration' and Wait
block-definition.comment: Plays the selected note for the specified musical duration. This block waits for the selected note to finish playing. A note name and duration (whole, half, quarter, etc.) can be selected from the drop-down menu.

inputs.input: CC3 D3 E3 F3 G3 A3 B3 C4 D4 E4 F4 G4 A4 B4 Sharps={ C#3 D#3 E#3 F#3 G#3 A#3 B#3 C#4 D#4 E#4 F#4 G#4 A#4 B#4 } Flats={ Cb3 Db3 Eb3 Fb3 Gb3 Ab3 Bb3 Cb4 Db4 Eb4 Fb4 Gb4 Ab4 Bb4 }

QuarterWhole Half Quarter Eighth Sixteenth Thirtysecond Dotted Notes={ Dotted Half Dotted Quarter Dotted Eighth Dotted Sixteenth } Triplet Notes={ Half Triplet Quarter Triplet Eighth Triplet Sixteenth Triplet }

block-definition.comment: Plays the selected note for the specified musical duration. This block does note wait for the selected note to finish playing. A note name and duration (whole, half, quarter, etc.) can be selected from the drop-down menu.

inputs.input: CC3 D3 E3 F3 G3 A3 B3 C4 D4 E4 F4 G4 A4 B4 Sharps={ C#3 D#3 E#3 F#3 G#3 A#3 B#3 C#4 D#4 E#4 F#4 G#4 A#4 B#4 } Flats={ Cb3 Db3 Eb3 Fb3 Gb3 Ab3 Bb3 Cb4 Db4 Eb4 Fb4 Gb4 Ab4 Bb4 }

block.comment: The javascript function handles converting a note name to number.

block-definition.comment: Waits for the selected musical duration.

inputs.input: QuarterWhole Half Quarter Eighth Sixteenth Thirtysecond Dotted Notes={ Dotted Half Dotted Quarter Dotted Eighth Dotted Sixteenth } Triplet Notes={ Half Triplet Quarter Triplet Eighth Triplet Sixteenth Triplet }

block-definition.comment: Each note duration is assigned a numerical value, with a whole note equallying four beats. Dotted Notes are equal to the named note plus half of the named note's duration. Triplet notes are equal in duration to two of the named notes divided by three. Since there are 60 seconds in a minute, dividing 60 by the tempo and then multiplying it by a note's duration alters the duration of the notes to make them match the global tempo.

inputs.input: QuarterWhole Half Quarter Eighth Sixteenth Thirtysecond Dotted Notes={ Dotted Half Dotted Quarter Dotted Eighth Dotted Sixteenth } Triplet Notes={ Half Triplet Quarter Triplet Eighth Triplet Sixteenth Triplet }

block-definition.comment: Plays a list of notes simultaneously for the specified musical duration.

block-definition.comment: Reports the note in a specific position within a major or minor musical scale. (e.g., The third note in a C Major scale starting in the fourth octave is E4.)

inputs.input: MajorChromatic Major Minor
CA B C D E F G sharps={ A# B# C# D# E# F# G# } flats={ Ab Bb Cb Db Eb Fb Gb }

block.comment: Arranges the Chromatic scale to begin with the input note.

scripts.comment: Reports all notes in a given diminished scale in order, beginning with the input note. Does not include octave.

block-definition.comment: Reports the notes of a diminished chord, given the starting note and octave of the chord.

inputs.input: CC C# / D♭=C# D4 D# / E♭=D# E F F# / G♭=F# G G# / A♭=G# A A# / B♭=B♭ B

block-definition.comment: Reports the notes comprising a major or minor chord, using the specified note and octave as the root note of the chord.

inputs.input: MajorMajor Minor
CC3 D3 E3 F3 G3 A3 B3 C4 D4 E4 F4 G4 A4 B4 Sharps={ C#3 D#3 E#3 F#3 G#3 A#3 B#3 C#4 D#4 E#4 F#4 G#4 A#4 B#4 } Flats={ Cb3 Db3 Eb3 Fb3 Gb3 Ab3 Bb3 Cb4 Db4 Eb4 Fb4 Gb4 Ab4 Bb4 }

block-definition.comment: This block finds the notes in a specified chord along the selected scale. Roman numerals differentiate chord positions from octave numbers (e.g., the Roman numeral “I” reports the notes of the first chord in the sequence). Upper case Roman numerals represent major chords within the scale. Lower case Roman numerals represent minor chords within the scale.

inputs.input: MajorMajor Minor
CC3 D3 E3 F3 G3 A3 B3 C4 D4 E4 F4 G4 A4 B4 Sharps={ C#3 D#3 E#3 F#3 G#3 A#3 B#3 C#4 D#4 E#4 F#4 G#4 A#4 B#4 } Flats={ Cb3 Db3 Eb3 Fb3 Gb3 Ab3 Bb3 Cb4 Db4 Eb4 Fb4 Gb4 Ab4 Bb4 }
IMajor Positions={ I ii iii IV V vi vii° } Minor Positions={ i ii° III iv v VI VII } Number Positions={ 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 }

block.comment: Outputs the major chords in a scale.
Outputs the minor chords in a scale.
Outputs the diminished chord in a scale.

block-definition.comment: This block reports a chord and appends an additional note.

inputs.input: CC3 D3 E3 F3 G3 A3 B3 C4 D4 E4 F4 G4 A4 B4 Sharps={ C#3 D#3 E#3 F#3 G#3 A#3 B#3 C#4 D#4 E#4 F#4 G#4 A#4 B#4 } Flats={ Cb3 Db3 Eb3 Fb3 Gb3 Ab3 Bb3 Cb4 Db4 Eb4 Fb4 Gb4 Ab4 Bb4 }

block-definition.comment: May be paired with a musical duration to insert a rest into a sequence of chords.
This block is used to group sequences of notes and chords into measures. Each note or chord in the measure is paired with a note duration. The pairs are entered into the block using a list.

This code block groups measures together. This can be helpful for separating groups of measures that repeat in various places throughout a song, like verses and choruses. This block works with both notes and chords. To add measures to a section, put the measures into a list.

This block determines if the combined durations of notes or chords within a measure are correct. The combined duration of notes within a measure must equal the number of beats specified by the time signature. For example, in 4/4 time, there can be four quarter notes within a measure. The Beats in Measure reports the discrepancy between the number of actual beats in a measure versus the required number of beats.

This block reports a series of beats that tell the drum when to play. Beats are represented as an “X,” which can be typed into the block. Beats can be added or subtracted using the arrows on the right of the block.

This block reports a drum pattern, assigns a drum to it, and sets the duration value of each item in the pattern. Different drums can be selected from the drop-down menu. Beat durations can be selected from the drop-down menu or entered directly.

inputs.input: Snare DrumBass Drum Snare Drum Crash Cymbal Cabasa Toms={ High Tom Mid Tom } Hi-Hats={ Closed Hi-hat Open Hi-hat }
EighthQuarter Eighth Sixteenth

block-definition.s: Track %'Type' Instrument %'Instrument' $nl Musical Notation (Notes or Chords) %'Notation'
block-definition.comment: This code block specifies the type of track to be played and assigns it an instrument. Both the track type and instrument are set using drop-down menus. This block accepts notes or chords paired with corresponding durations. This block also allows for the creation of note or chord loops that will repeat for the whole duration of the song. Both types of loops may be selected from the track drop-down menu. For a loop to play, it must have an accompanying track that is not a loop.

inputs.input: MelodyMelody Chords Loops={ Loop-Melody Loop-Chords Loop-Drums }

PianoPiano Brass={ French Horn Trumpet Tuba } Strings={ Banjo Bass, Acoustic Bass, Electric (Finger) Cello Guitar, Acoustic Guitar, Electric Guitar, Overdrive Harp Koto Sitar Violin } Woodwinds={ Bassoon Clarinet Flute Oboe Saxophone Shakuhachi } Drums={ Cabasa Snare Drum Bass Drum Closed Hi-Hat Open Hi-Hat Mid Tom High Tom Crash Cymbal } Other={ Accordion Marimba Music Box Organ Vibraphone }

block-definition.comment: This block is used to play multiple music tracks. In most cases, several tracks with musical instruments are played in parallel.

block-definition.comment: The second input is an "association list," a list of two-item lists. Each of those smaller lists has a "key" as its first item and a "value" as its second. ASSOC reports the first key-value pair in the association list whose key matches the first input.

block-definition.comment: Takes any number of Boolean (true/false) inputs (use the left and right arrowheads to adjust the number of input slots) and reports TRUE only if all of the inputs are TRUE, otherwise FALSE. Like AND but for multiple inputs.
block-definition.translations: pt:todas as afirmações _ são verdadeiras ca:tots _ ?

inputs.input: II II III IV V VI VII VIII IX X

block.l: if("clipboard" in navigator) { navigator.clipboard.writeText(thing) } else {alert("I can't send thing to clipboard.")}

var done = false, thing = null if("clipboard" in navigator) { navigator.clipboard.readText(thing).then(x => {thing = x; done = true}) } else {alert("I can't retrieve thing from clipboard."); done = true} return new List([function() {return done}, function() {return thing}])

var done = false ,thing = new Costume( newCanvas(new Point( 1, 1), true), "empty") ,item = null const error = (function Error( txt){ done = true;throw txt;}) if( "clipboard" in navigator) { navigator.clipboard.read() .then( clipData => { item = clipData.find( v => v.types.includes("image/png") ); if( !item) error( "No image data") item.getType("image/png") .then( blob => { var url = (window.URL || window.webkitURL).createObjectURL( blob); var img = new Image(); img.onload = function () { canvas = newCanvas(new Point(img.width, img.height), true); canvas.getContext('2d').drawImage(img, 0, 0); thing = new Costume( canvas, "Clipboard") done = true; }; img.src = url; return; }) .catch(err => error("No PNG data: "+err)); }) .catch(err => error( "I can't retrieve thing from clipboard: "+err)); } else {alert("I can't retrieve thing from clipboard."); done = true} return new List([ function(){return done}, function(){return thing}])
